documents.title: our coverage across the day
text: that 's it for our updates on friday .
join us again from 08:00 on tuesday for more news , sport , travel and weather .

documents.title: one arrested after nuneaton robbery
text: a man 's been arrested after an armed robbery in a nuneaton bank , police say .
they say they were called to the scene , believed to be a branch of nat west , shortly after midday when a man threatened staff and demanded money .
a quantity of cash was handed over .

documents.title: scenes from shakespeare celebration
text: the shakespeare birthplace trust said a `` fresh and diverse '' offering helped make this year 's birthday celebrations a huge success .
thousands turned out in stratford-upon-avon to celebrate shakespeare 's 453rd birthday last saturday .
james willets sent in these

documents.title: bmw workers target 'posh ' showroom
text: bmw workers are set to stage a protest outside the german car-maker 's showroom on london 's park lane on saturday as part of a dispute over pensions .
members of the unite union will take part in the demonstration ahead of a further six days of industrial action at bmw plants around the country , including hams hall in warwickshire .
bmw angered workers when it announced plans to close its final salary pension scheme .
unite national officer fred hanna said `` the protest outside the car maker 's posh park lane showroom '' would highlight a need to talk about `` affordable options to keep the scheme open '' .

documents.title: fishery closed after outbreak of disease
text: an outbreak of spring viraemia of carp ( svc ) disease has been confirmed at arden lakes , stratford-upon-avon .
the centre for environment fisheries and aquaculture science said that the fishery on ingon lane in snitterfield is now subject to statutory controls to prevent or limit the spread of the disease .
that means the movement of fish to , from and within the site is not allowed .
a statement on arden lakes ' website said it would be closed until further notice .

documents.title: third person faces murder charge over gregory kelly death
text: a third man has been charged with murdering gregory kelly in mancetter at the end of march .
the 26 year old died five days after being found with critical head injuries on manor road .
robert keavey , 38 , of princess road in atherstone was remanded in custody at an appearance at leamington spa magistrates ' court earlier .

documents.title: new affordable housing development in leamington officially opened
text: the new development , which is called union park , is a £ 29 million development of 147 affordable family homes on the former soans ' motor dealership site in sydenham .
author: Warwick Courier

documents.title: travel warning issued ahead of horse fair
text: police are warning of travel disruptions in kenilworth because of the horse fair this weekend .
hundreds are expected at the event , which starts today , at the junction with the a46 warwick bypass and a452 leamington road .
# kenilworthhorsefair this weekend on site at junction of a46 & leamington rd , allow extra time for your journey or use alternative route

documents.title: employee celebrates 70 years at firm
text: a woman who 's believed to be the uk 's longest-serving employee is celebrating 70 years working for an engineering firm .
monica evans , 89 , has been working at kigass ltd in warwickshire since april 1947 .
she started as an accountant aged 19 and has had decades of unbroken service .
during that time she 's seen the company grow from six to 70 employees and says she is thrilled to be honoured by her colleagues .
author: Susie Rack
BBC Coventry and Warwickshire

documents.title: coventry city : injury-hampered squad for last match
text: coventry city boss confirms that his squad is suffering with a number of injuries entering the end of season tie with scunthorpe united .
mark robins said : we 've got a lot of injuries , a lot of players suffering with injury .
hopefully we 'll have enough to turn out a team .
it has been a tough week , because training is disjointed without the numbers .
i hope we 'll be okay , we have got to finish it off properly . ''

documents.title: two hatchlings for the leamington peregrines
text: two peregrine falcon chicks have hatched at the top of the tower of leamington town hall .
there have been four eggs in total so all eyes are on the other two .
you can watch them on warwick district 's live webcam here .
the new arrivals @ twitterid
why ca n't we see them on the webcam ?
does the mum still sit on them even after they 're hatched ?
the camera is working , i think they 're currently being fed
i think there is a lot of traffic now .
just had changeover .
camera definitely working
all 's well .
yes , the chicks will be under the adult .
congrats !
thank you
babiesare marvellous and she looks so proud mom !
what a day !
hoping for two more soon
ca n't wait ! ! ! !
am i the only one running around the house losing my shit at the news of the birth ? !
i feel like i 've carried them to full term myself !
they hatched ! ! !
still 2 more to go keep an eye on them here
aww congrats mum & dad .
kinda guessing all local birds not so happy lol
congrats , super cute
squeeeeeeeee !
i seen the the first early this morning then i looked at lunchtime and another eayass was hatched the parents will be busy now
@ twitterid 2 chicks in # sheffield too
author: Vanessa Pearce
BBC Local Live

documents.title: woman clocks up 70 years with same firm
text: woman clocks up 70 years with same firm

documents.title: city of culture bid submitted
text: coventry 's bid to become the uk 's city of culture in 2021 is now in the hands of the government .
the trust organising the bid submitted it yesterday , outlining what it 'd put on if it won the competition .
david burbidge , chair of the coventry city of culture trust , said it 's now just a matter of waiting .
sorry for the shouty tweet but we 've submitted the initial bid !
# thisiscoventry # andnowwewait
good luck guys
bye , bye , bid-y
author: BBC Coventry & Warwickshire

documents.title: mini crimewave hits nuneaton community
text: a mini crimewave has hit new housing estates in nuneaton after car thieves targeted more than ten vehicles in one night .
author: Nuneaton News

documents.title: one-day cup : hain helps warwickshire to victory
text: sam hain 's unbeaten 89 helped holders warwickshire race to a 10-wicket victory over northants in a rain-affected one-day cup match .
he said he `` felt a bit of pressure '' coming into the competition `` so it 's nice to get on the board here with a few runs '' .

documents.title: government wants coventry and jaguar land rover to be heart of global car industry
text: the government wants to establish coventry as the uk 's 'motor city ' after it provided the inspiration for the prime minister 's industrial strategy .
author: Coventry Telegraph

documents.title: tool thefts on rise
text: a bbc investigation has found that the number of tool thefts from vans in the west midlands has almost doubled in the last three years .
there were more than 2,500 thefts between 2014 and 2015 , and last year that number had risen to more than 4,500 .
it 's thought criminals are buying locksmith tools off the internet and using them to gain access to vehicles .
author: BBC Midlands Today

documents.title: premiership : wasps expecting close game at the stoop
text: wasps will look to secure home advantage in the premiership play off semi finals this evening .
the club needs just one victory and travels to harlequins tonight .
director of rugby dai young said he 's expecting a close battle .
quins have only lost two premiership games there this season , one of those being the last time out against exeter .
they will be hurting from that loss and want to put that right on friday at a sold-out stoop .
team news : dai young names his side to travel to the stoop on friday to face @ twitterid in @ twitterid ko 7.45pm
live on bt sport 1 ?
get pumpppeed boiii @ twitterid
looking good ! ! !
see you there
ooooof , it 's a good team , and what a team to be playing against .
let 's remind them who we are !
# coyw .
good team out looking forward to being there to support you all on friday night
got to love this team coyw
author: BBC Coventry & Warwickshire Sport

documents.title: video : what 's the weather doing today ?
text: a generally dry day with occasional sunny spells and the risk of a couple of isolated showers - highs of 12c ( 54f ) .
author: Charlie Slater
BBC Weather presenter

documents.title: live updates for coventry and warwickshire
text: welcome to the local live service for coventry and warwickshire on friday .
we 'll be bringing you all the news , sport , travel and weather as it happens .
if you 'd like to get in touch you can .
email , tweet us @ bbccovwarks or message via facebook .
author: Vanessa Pearce
BBC Local Live

documents.title: hain takes 2016 form into bears win
text: hain takes 2016 form into bears win

documents.title: our live coverage across the day
text: live updates have finished for the day but local stories will be added automatically through the night .

documents.title: coventry to host city ride event
text: it 's been announced that coventry will host one of 13 city-centre , family-friendly city rides this summer .
the coventry ride , in partnership with the city council , will take place on sunday , 17 september .
- the exact route is yet to be confirmed .

documents.title: coming up on midlands today
text: families in rugby say they 're being forced to consider sending their children to secondary schools in leicestershire because of a shortage of places .
they 've accused education bosses of failing to build enough schools to meet demand , as thousands of new homes are built in the borough .
but warwickshire county council deny there 's a crisis and says new schools will be built .
see more on bbc midlands today on bbc 1 at 18:30 .
author: Ben Godfrey
BBC Midlands Today

documents.title: weather : a cloudy end to the week
text: it 's looking like being a cloudy end to the week , with some showers forecast tomorrow .
author: Shefali Oza
BBC Midlands Today

documents.title: rugby : wasps name side to take on harlequins
text: director of rugby , dai young , has named his side to travel to the twickenham stoop on friday night to face harlequins .
josh bassett is set to make his 50th appearance for the club , as he 's named to start on the wing .
team news : dai young names his side to travel to the stoop on friday to face @ twitterid in @ twitterid ko 7.45pm
live on bt sport 1 ?
get pumpppeed boiii @ twitterid
looking good ! ! !
see you there
ooooof , it 's a good team , and what a team to be playing against .
let 's remind them who we are !
# coyw .
good team out looking forward to being there to support you all on friday night
got to love this team coyw

documents.title: stolen gems and jewellery images released
text: images of jewellery stolen during a burglary in walsgrave have been released in the hope people might spot them .
the property , on starcross close , was broken into some time between 13-15 april and a number of unusual vintage pieces , worth around £ 5,000 , were stolen , police say .

documents.title: will you be voting for a west midlands metro mayor ?
text: we now know that 1,961,153 people are registered to vote in the west midlands mayoral election , but what percentage will actually turn up to a polling station ?
the imposition of a mayor has angered many who point to the fact that birmingham and coventry rejected the office by referendum in 2012 .
in addition , there are no other elections on 4 may and some predictions say turnout could dip into single figures .
that would be even lower than the 2014 west midlands police and crime commissioner election , where only 10.4 % of people exercised their democratic right .
with polling experts suggesting a neck and neck contest between labour and the conservatives , the candidates know every vote counts .
all six will debate live on bbc wm from bournville college between 19:00 and 20:00 tonight .
author: Rob Mayor
Political reporter, BBC WM

documents.title: two taken to hospital after longford collision
text: two people have been taken to hospital after a multi-vehicle collision in the longford area of coventry , says the ambulance service .
they were called to longford road around 10:00 .

documents.title: 'alarming ' number of railway trespasses sparks warning
text: youngsters are being urged not to dice with death on the region 's railways this summer .
author: Leamington Observer

documents.title: cricket : rain delays play in one-day cup
text: the weather is playing a big part in warwickshire 's royal london one-day cup opener against northamptonshire .
the match at wantage road has now been reduced to 33 overs a side .
update | play scheduled to restart at 4pm providing that there 's no further rain .
game reduced to 33 overs each # youbears

documents.title: 'minor ' injuries after straight mile horsebox crash
text: a person suffered `` minor '' injuries after a crash involving a car and a horsebox on straight mile near rugby yesterday .
author: Rugby Advertiser

documents.title: city of culture 2021 bid complete
text: at over 30 pages long , with more than 20,000 words , coventry 's bid document to be the uk city of culture 2021 is now complete .
hundreds gathered at the city 's cathedral this week to celebrate the moment , and wave the bid off .

as well as setting out a programme of events that would take place , in the event of a successful bid , the docoment shows how it would have a lasting and positive impact on the city , organisers said .

documents.title: school re-opens after travellers leave
text: camp hill primary school in nuneaton has re-opened after a group of travellers moved from nearby land .
the school has been closed since monday after around 20 caravans moved on to the site .
nuneaton and bedworth borough council secured a court order earlier giving the travellers 24 hours ' notice to leave before it brought in bailiffs .

documents.title: jaguar land rover boss says car building could return to coventry after government talks
text: jaguar land rover boss ralf speth has spoken optimistically about the prospect of car manufacturing returning to coventry .
author: Coventry Telegraph

documents.title: leamington through to play-off final
text: leamington town are through to the southern league premier division play-off final after beating slough 1-0 at the new windmill .
jack edwards scored the only goal of the game , to set up a promotion final against hitching town at home on bank holiday monday .
ft : leamington 1-0 slough town .
we 're in the play off final !
were is it being played at does anyone know ?
it is being played at leamington .
3pm ko # coyb
congratulations on reaching the play off final .
fantastic achievement
get in there coyb
author: BBC Coventry & Warwickshire Sport

documents.title: relocation of 250 jobs 'disappointing '
text: relocation of 250 jobs 'disappointing '

documents.title: calls made for council to halt new hq plans
text: calls have been made for warwick district council to halt plans to build new multi-million pound offices in leamington .
author: Leamington Observer

documents.title: west midlands leading the way in manufacturing
text: the west midlands is the leader in creating manufacturing jobs across europe , according to new figures .
wolverhampton is the city with the most new jobs , while solhihull , coventry and birmingham also made it into the top 10 .
the figures from the financial times show almost 17,000 jobs were created in the region between january 2012 and december last year .
author: Elizabeth Glinka
BBC Midlands Today

documents.title: longford collision causing travel delays
text: police are dealing with at a collision in the longford area of coventry .
national express say they 're experiencing delays of up to 30 minutes to services in the area .
we are experiencing delays of up to 30 mins on 20/20a/20e due to rti at longford square .

documents.title: 'clear way forward ' : rugby council 's priorities plan approved
text: the ruling rugby conservative councillors ' plan for the next three years was approved on tuesday with promises for their progress to be scrutinised annually .
author: Rugby Advertiser

documents.title: cat shot with air rifle loses leg
text: a cat has had a leg amputated after being shot by an air rifle `` at close range '' in the earlsdon area of coventry , say the rspca .
the `` deliberate '' and `` brutal '' act of cruelty left smudge with a shattered bone , said rspca inspector louise marston , and left the animal in pain .
it is very distressing to think that people take pleasure in causing such horrific injuries to defenceless animals '' , she said .
the animal is thought to have been targeted between 07:00 and 08:00 on wednesday 12 april in stanway road .

documents.title: one-day cup : northants v warwickshire
text: warwickshire begin their title defence at northamptonshire in the one-day cup starting at 11:00 .
you can follow all the live action here .

documents.title: samaritans volunteers turn out in force to raise awareness at coventry station
text: samaritans volunteers were out in force at train stations across the west midlands on wednesday to help raise awareness of the charity 's life-saving services .
author: Coventry Observer

documents.title: council 'disappointed ' at loss of 250 jobs
text: coventry city council say they 're `` disappointed '' at the royal institution of chartered surveyor 's ( rics ) decision not to move its headquarters to the friargate development in the city .
the decision means 250 jobs will leave the city as the organisation announced it would also vacate their current home at westwood business park .
in a statement , the council said the decision `` does not affect our determination todeliver the wider friargate business district which will regenerate a key area of the city centre '' .

documents.title: mancetter chicken broiler approved by government inspector
text: disappointed mancetter residents have lost their battle over controversial plans to build a chicken broiler in the village .
author: Atherstone & Coleshill Herald

documents.title: almost 400 acid attacks in region
text: new figures obtained by the bbc show there were nearly 400 acid attacks in our region in the last three years .
west midlands police says it recorded 372 attacks .
in staffordshire there were five and in warwickshire there were nine .
across the uk , more than 400 people were hurt so badly they were admitted to hospital after being attacked with acid or other corrosive substances .
author: BBC Midlands Today

documents.title: funding for art and design in secondary schools
text: the victoria and albert museum is to work with the herbert museum and art gallery and the coventry transport museum as part of a national education programme to preserve art and design in secondary schools .
the museum was named winner of the £ 100,000 art fund prize , the largest arts award in britain , in june last year for its display of imagination , innovation and achievement .
the v & a will use that funding for a programme that will target pupils aged between 11 and 16 in predominantly industrial areas in partnership with local museums and regional creative industries .

documents.title: video : your 50-second weather forecast
text: after a cool start to the day , with some bright patches , cloud will thicken with outbreaks of mainly light and patchy rain and highs of 12c ( 54f ) .
you can find a detailed forecast for your area on the bbc weather site .
author: Lucy Martin
BBC Weather

documents.title: welcome to live updates for coventry and warwickshire
text: welcome to the local live service for coventry and warwickshire on thursday .
we 'll be bringing you all the news , sport , travel and weather as it happens .
if you 'd like to get in touch you can .
email , tweet us @ bbccovwarks or message via facebook .
author: Vanessa Pearce
BBC Local Live

documents.title: our coverage across the day
text: we 're back from 08:00 on thursday with more news , sport , travel and weather updates .

documents.title: £ 1m boost for nuneaton 's crippled a & e department
text: it has been revealed that the department of health is to give a & e services at the george eliot hospital £ 1m to help ease pressure for winter 2017/18 .
author: Nuneaton News

documents.title: weather : a mixed outlook for the region
text: we 're forecast a real mixture of weather tonight and tomorrow , including everything from warm sunshine to snow .
author: Shefali Oza
BBC Midlands Today

documents.title: endangered gibbon born at atherstone zoo
text: a critically endangered species of ape has been born at a zoo in atherstone .
the birth of the northern white-cheeked gibbon , born at twycross zoo , is being seen as a way of helping to protect the species ' longevity .
the new arrival is yet to be named .

documents.title: netball : wasps boss says side need 'one more win ' for top finish
text: wasps netball manager , tamsin greenway , says her team need a single win to secure a final four spot in the vitality netball superleague .
the side are set to take on league-leaders loughborough lightning on saturday , followed by severn stars on monday .
wasps are currently second in the superleague , with a 12 point advantage over team bath in fifth place .
author: Martin Winch
BBC Coventry & Warwickshire Sport

documents.title: search on to rehome dog with 'shakespeare style ' ruff
text: an animal welfare charity is trying to rehome a dog said to bear an uncanny resemblance to william shakespeare .
the dogs trust 's branch in kenilworth claims five-year-old rocco 's distinctive fur collar is similar to the elizabethan-era ruff which was often worn by the bard .
the charity says that staff have nicknamed the stray the woof in the ruff while looking after him .

documents.title: blow as 250 jobs to leave coventry with firm 's birmingham move
text: the royal institute of chartered surveyors has announced it is no longer staying in coventry after its bid to move to the new friargate site fell through .
the decision means that 250 jobs will leave the city as the organisation vacate their current home at westwood business park in favour of birmingham .

while we are obviously disappointed that the proposal to move into a new development in coventry city centre did not materialise we are more than satisfied that our new premises will fit our organisational needs and vision for the future .

documents.title: parents 'delighted ' by ministers ' pledge to introduce tougher sentences
text: the parents of a hit-and-run victim have spoken of their delight after ministers pledged to introduce tougher sentences for dangerous drivers , should the conservative party win the upcoming general election
sean morley , 20 , was killed in a collision with a car as he walked along a section of the a444 near bedworth in september 2012 .
his parents , kerry and gary , have since campaigned for tougher sentences for dangerous drivers alongside their local mp craig tracey .
we are glad that despite the election , the government is still determined to see through this really important reform .
stricter punishments to fit the crime of dangerous drivers will help to achieve the justice which we were not afforded with sean .

documents.title: warwickshire policeman awarded for bravery
text: a police officer in warwickshire has been commended for his bravery at an awards ceremony .
sgt alan edwards ( second left ) arrested two men in stratford-upon-avon following an armed robbery at a jewellery shop last september .
the officer noticed the men acting sus in the town and managed to restrain one of them before later apprehending the second as he hid in a garden .
both men were subsequently charged with armed robbery and linked to a number of similar offences around the country .

documents.title: ten sentenced after armed robbery in newark
text: ten people have been sentenced for their part in an armed robbery in newark , nottinghamshire police said .
four men were seen to enter andrew michael 's jewellers on stodman street armed with hammers and a shotgun .
about £ 250,000 worth of watches and jewellery were stolen .
as the group were about to escape , they were confronted by two off-duty lincolnshire police officers who had heard the commotion .

the force said they tried to stop the offenders even though they were threatened , one of them grabbed a man as he got into a getaway car and was dragged some feet down the road before the offenders got away .
nine defendants admitted their involvement at an earlier hearing .
they are :
meanwhile , abdul khalique , 38 , of pickard street , islington in london , was found guilty of conspiracy to convert stolen property after a trial and sentenced to 12 months in prison .
author: Alex Smith
BBC News Online

documents.title: plans for new homes in alcester and lower quinton
text: nearly 200 new homes could be built in alcester .

outline planning permission has already been granted to developers bloor homes , gallagher estates and pettifer developments , but they have now revealed they hope to build 190 homes close to allimore lane .
author: Stratford Observer

documents.title: warwickshire school set for multimillion-pound move
text: an all-girls school in warwick is set to be relocated as part of a new £ 30m campus .
the district council has given planning permission for king 's high to move on to land shared by warwick school and warwick preparatory school .
enhanced sports facilities and a new music centre will be built as part of the project , with all buildings set to open by 2020 .
this is a very exciting opportunity , both for our current and future pupils , which we believe will offer unrivalled educational opportunities . ''

documents.title: coventry skateboarders team up with pensioners
text: skateboarders in coventry are working with pensioners to improve facilities for young people in the city .
campaigners for a new urban sports hub have earmarked land under junction 8 and 9 of the city 's ring road .
councillors are now discussing ways to develop the proposals .
we 've actually indicated a will to work with young people it 's not just in the recent history , it actually goes back over a year .
author: BBC Coventry & Warwickshire

documents.title: school 'closed by travellers ' to reopen
text: school 'closed by travellers ' to reopen

documents.title: ufc veteran melvin guillard and bare-knuckle boxer come face-to-face in coventry restaurant row
text: footage has emerged of two bare-knuckle boxers - including a ufc veteran - involved in two intense altercations following a sell-out show in coventry .
author: Coventry Telegraph

documents.title: sisters prepare to 'pedal for parkinson 's ' to raise research funds
text: two sisters are preparing to cycle a 60-mile route through stratford-upon-avon in june to raise money for parkinson 's research .
gillian blundell and heather wright are taking on the challenge after their dad noel was diagnosed with the disease in 2012 .
it 's part of an annual event , hosted by parkinson 's uk , which is expected to encourage more than two hundred cyclists to get involved .

documents.title: reservoir visitors urged to stay safe
text: visitors to a warwickshire reservoir are being warned not to swim in the water .
draycote water , a country park near dunchurch , often proves popular with tourists in the summer months .
but severn trent say the reservoir there is built with the sole purpose of supplying water to their customers and not for swimming .
when it 's a nice day and with the weather getting better , we 'll start to see more people venture into the water to cool off or have a paddle but this can lead to a serious risk to life .

documents.title: would-be friargate tenant and city firm rics quits coventry for birmingham
text: a would-be tenant of coventry city centre 's flagship friargate business park , next to the station , has announced today it is moving to birmingham instead .
author: Coventry Observer

documents.title: much-loved leamington pub set for transformation
text: it 's emerged a pub in leamington spa , which had been rumoured to be closing permanently , is now set for a £ 400,000 renovation .
speculation over the future of the 'jug & jester ' began when closed notices were put up over the weekend .
but the buildings new owners , the stonegate pub company , say it will be transformed and renamed 'the old library ' ahead of its grand opening next month .
author: Simon Glover
BBC Online

documents.title: nuneaton school closed for third day as travellers leave nearby site
text: a primary school in nuneaton is closed for a third day as a nearby site that was occupied by travellers is cleaned up .

it 's after the borough council obtained a court order yesterday to evict the group , whose presence had resulted in the indefinite closure of camp hill primary school over health and safety concerns .
some pupils have been taken in by nearby michael drayton junior school in order to limit disruption to their exam studies .
it has now been confirmed that the school will re-open tomorrow as normal .
author: Richard Williams
BBC Coventry & Warwickshire

documents.title: woman injured as car hits tree
text: a woman has been admitted to a major trauma centre after a car left a road and struck a tree in warwickshire .
the crash took place at 19:15 yesterday on the burton hills road in burton dassett .
the 33-year-old , who was a passenger in the front seat of the vehicle , was taken to university hospital coventry and warwickshire complaining of back and abdominal pain .
the driver was uninjured .

documents.title: ice hockey : blaze player 'enjoying ' world championship experience
text: coventry blaze 's liam stewart says he 's enjoying the experience of his first international ice hockey tournament .
the forward , who 's the son of singer sir rod stewart and former model rachel hunter , made his international debut for great britain on sunday in the world championship in belfast .
gb face lithuania in division 1 group b later today .
it 's a veteran group and they 're real welcoming we 've got a great team .
author: Geoff Foster
BBC Coventry & Warwickshire Sport

documents.title: thousands of vehicles seized during crackdown on uninsured drivers
text: a total of 12,296 vehicles were seized in the past 12 months as part of a crackdown on uninsured and unlicensed drivers , police have revealed .
the vehicles , which included a lamborghini huracan and bentley continental , were pulled off the roads between april 2016 and march this year after drivers were caught breaking the law .
the force say uninsured drivers can face six to eight points on their license , a £ 300 fixed penalty notice or a substantial fine if the matter is pursued through the courts .
author: Simon Glover
BBC Online

documents.title: bears can peak again in the cup - bell
text: bears can peak again in the cup - bell

documents.title: police issue traffic warning ahead of kenilworth horse fair
text: motorists are being urged to allow extra time for their journeys through kenilworth over the weekend due to the town 's annual horse fair .
the event , taking place on a site near the junction with the a46 warwick bypass and a452 leamington road , is likely to see major traffic congestion .
police says traffic management plans , extra officers and parking restrictions will be put in place to limit disruption .

documents.title: police appealing for information after spate of cars thefts near rugby
text: police are appealing for information after three vehicles were stolen from homes near rugby .
author: Rugby Advertiser

documents.title: football : big turnout expected for brakes ' semi final clash
text: a bumper crowd is expected at the new windmill this evening as leamington host slough in their southern league premier division play- off semi final .
the brakes manager paul holleran has been forced to draft in former midfielder richard batchelor for the tie due to a number of squad injuries .
author: Clive Eakin
BBC Coventry & Warwickshire Sport

documents.title: your sunny southam
text: weather watcher old salt sent in this lovely from southam , warwickshire .
you can sign up and become a bbc weather watcher here .
author: BBC Weather Watchers

documents.title: one in six coventry hospital a & e patients wait four hours as nhs hits 'breaking point '
text: one in six a & e patients in coventry faced a wait of more than four hours as performance at university hospital coventry and warwickshire dramatically declines .
author: Coventry Telegraph

documents.title: coventry university is top 'new university '
text: coventry university is celebrating after it reclaimed the title of top `` new '' university in the latest complete university guide for 2018 .
as well as becoming the uk 's highest-ranking former college or polytechnic , coventry has climbed seven places to 43rd in the overall university rankings .
author: BBC Midlands Today

documents.title: watch : your 50-second weather forecast
text: cold , bright and perhaps frosty at first .
sunny spells and occasional showers through the morning .
more frequent showers during the afternoon , perhaps with the risk of hail and thunder at times .
feeling rather cold .
highs of 10c ( 50f ) .
you can read a full forecast on the bbc weather page .
author: Charlie Slater
BBC Weather presenter

documents.title: good morning from the coventry newsroom
text: welcome to the local live service for coventry and warwickshire on wednesday .
we 'll be bringing you all the news , sport , travel and weather as it happens .
if you 'd like to get in touch you can .
email , tweet us @ bbccovwarks or message via facebook .

documents.title: our coverage across the day
text: that was tuesday .
we 're back from 08:00 on wednesday with more news , sport , travel and weather updates .

documents.title: who 'll call tune if midlands swings ?
text: who 'll call tune if midlands swings ?
author: Patrick Burns
Political editor, Midlands

documents.title: coming up on midlands today : veteran cyclist takes on giro d'italia at 77
text: a 78-year-old cyclist from coventry is to ride the 3,400 km route of the giro d'italia .
mick ives aims to raise £ 60,000 for charity to mark his 60th year in the sport .
he says this will be his toughest challenge yet .
the flying 'maglia rosa ' or pink jersey is mick ives from bagington , near coventry .
aged 78 he 's riding the 3,400km giro d'italia route
author: BBC Midlands Today

documents.title: travellers force school closure again
text: travellers force school closure again

documents.title: coventry rugby club secure all blacks tuiotupou
text: coventry rugby club have signed the former all blacks centre sam tuitupou on a two-year contract .
the 35 year old has spent the last six years playing for the premiership club sale sharks .
author: Martin Winch
BBC Coventry & Warwickshire Sport

documents.title: weather : another chilly night ahead
text: it 's going to be another chilly night and the gritters are going out around the region .
lows of 1c ( 34f ) .
author: Charlie Slater
BBC Weather presenter

documents.title: kenilworth family devastated after their dog dies following attack from another dog
text: a family in kenilworth has been left devastated after their dog died after being attacked by another dog .
author: Leamington Courier

documents.title: travellers starting to move off land near nuneaton school
text: around half of the travellers who set up camp near a nuneaton school have left the land after being served an eviction notice by the borough council .
chair of the school governors at camp hill primary , which has been closed for two days , said she was meeting with the head teacher this evening to decide when the school could re-open .
county councillor corinne davies said the decision to close was to safeguard students ' health amid concerns over litter .

documents.title: woakes in squad for champions trophy and south africa series
text: warwickshire all-rounder chris woakes has been included in the 15-man squad for a one-day series against south africa and the champions trophy that follows .
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: shakespeare dog feeling a little ruff
text: a rescue dog nicknamed the `` woof in the ruff '' because of his fur 's resemblance to shakespearean garb is in need of a new home .
staff at the dogs trust in kenilworth are hoping that stray crossbreed rocco will one day exit stage left with a new family .
we 're told his favourite play is as you lick it .
but how does he smell ?
as sweetly by any other name of course .
the organisation 's sandra foulds said `` we 're hoping if we put him in the spotlight , someone will declare their everlasting love and ensure he becomes the true star he is destined to be '' .
have you seen any other animals with a passing resemblance to the bard ?
cat is the question .

documents.title: skelton sports a black eye at palace
text: showjumping champion nick skelton received his cbe from fellow rider the princess royal at buckingham palace today .
the olympic champion from bedworth sported a black eye for the ceremony and was asked by princess anne how the injury came about .
`` she said 'i hope that was horse-related ' - but it actually was n't , i fell and hit a wall . ''
skelton , who was made an obe after the london olym said it was `` a great honour to be upgraded '' .
he said he was `` very proud to receive it , and proud of what i 've done for the sport and for the country '' .

documents.title: ukip mep quits post over burka ban
text: west midlands ukip mep james carver has resigned as the party 's foreign and commonwealth affairs spokesman .
it follows the announcement of the party 's policy pledge to ban the muslim tradition of women wearing full face veils .
mr carver said he `` strongly disagreed '' with the `` misguided policy '' .
he said `` no-one has the right to dictate what people should wear '' .

documents.title: peregrine watchers waiting for hatchlings
text: all eyes are on the pair of peregrine falcons nesting at the top of leamington spa 's clock tower this week .
they 've been incubating four eggs , which could all start hatching in the next few days .
you can watch them on warwick district 's live webcam here .
author: Vanessa Pearce
BBC Local Live

documents.title: giant selfie to mark culture bid
text: people are being urged to go to coventry cathedral ruins at 16:30 to take part in giant selfie to celebrate coventry 's uk city of culture bid being sent off to the judges .

the official submission goes to the department for culture media & sport on friday and the bid organisers want as many people as possible to take part in the photo to show the local level of support .

documents.title: villagers face going to 'lock-down ' if huge sherbourne park event goes ahead
text: villagers fear they will have to go into 'lock-down ' if a massive college ball at sherbourne park is allowed to go ahead .
author: Stratford Observer

documents.title: 'driverless pod ' company signs us deal
text: `` autonomous vehicle '' manufacturer rdm group has signed an agreement with a large american design firm to pursue transportation projects in the us .
the coventry company is already working with arup to deliver uk autodrive , which will see driverless pods being trialled in coventry and milton keynes .
miles garner , from rdm , said the collaboration would offer a `` massive opportunity '' to take its technology to the united states .
author: Vanessa Pearce
BBC Local Live

documents.title: drugged-up driver locked up just months after being spared jail
text: a drug driver who was spared jail in january after he crashed into another car following a police chase has been put behind bars .
author: Coventry Telegraph

documents.title: twycross zoo welcomes new arrival
text: a northern white-cheeked gibbon has been born at twycross zoo .
northern white-cheeked gibbons are classed as a `` critically endangered '' species and this birth is being seen as a way of helping to protect their longevity .
the zoo 's new arrival is yet to be named .
author: Calum McKenzie
BBC Local Live

documents.title: women 's tour : interactive map launched
text: an interactive map of the women 's tour through warwickshire has been launched .
the 151 km stage will start in atherstone at 10:00 on 9 june , ending in leamington spa later that day .
author: Vanessa Pearce
BBC Local Live
